reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the collection of data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that personal data is collected when using the app, and it details the types of data collected and the purposes for which they are processed.
reply.reference: In the following, we provide information about the collection of personal data when using our mobile app (hereinafter only 'App'). Personal data is any data that can be related to a specific natural person, such as their name or IP address. URL: https://www.onvy.health/privacy-app

source_documents.excerpt:
PRIVACY POLICY MOBILE APP
1. Introduction
In the following, we provide information about the collection of personal data when using our mobile app (hereinafter only "App").
Personal data is any data that can be related to a specific natural person, such as their name or IP address.
1.1. Contact details
The controller within the meaning of Art. 4 (7) EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is Onvy HealthTech Group GmbH, Schloßstraße 19, 82031 Grünwald, Germany, email: contact@onvy.health. We...

is required by law.
1.8. Making contact
When contacting us, e.g. by e-mail or telephone, the data provided to us (e.g. names and e-mail addresses) will be stored by us in order to answer questions. The legal basis for the processing is our legitimate interest (Art. 6 para. 1 s. 1 lit. f GDPR) to answer inquiries directed to us. We delete the data accruing in this context after the storage is no longer necessary or restrict the processing if there are legal retention obligations.
2. Data processi...

mobile app to the user's mobile device.
Users can also download this mobile app directly to their mobile device via our website. When downloading, further user data is processed via the website, which we inform about in the privacy policy of our website.
2.2. Hosting
Our app is hosted by Amazon Web Services. The provider thereby processes the personal data transmitted via the app, e.g. on content, usage, meta/communication data or contact data. It is our legitimate interest to provide an app, so...

agreement concluded with the user via the app.
The data processed to this extent are
● Only the data entered into the app by the user themselves
● Public IP address to get the ap. location for weather data, .
2.6. User account
Users can open a user account in the app. We process the data requested in this context to fulfill the respective user contract concluded for the account, so that the legal basis for the processing is Art. 6 para. 1 s. 1 lit. b GDPR. We delete the data when users delete th...

in our applications and on our websites. The provider is RevenueCat, Inc., headquartered in the USA. RevenueCat acts as a data processor under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), while we act as the data controller. This means we are responsible for disclosing and protecting the personal data we transmit to RevenueCat.
RevenueCat processes usage data (e.g., visited websites, content interests, access times), content data (e.g., inputs in online forms), and meta/communication data (e.g...

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects IP address, date and time of the request, time zone difference, content of the request, access status, amount of data transferred, operating system details, language and version of the operating system, data entered by the user themselves, and the public IP address.

content: Date and time of the request
Time zone difference from Greenwich Mean Time (GMT)
Language and version of the operating system
Data entered into the app by the user themselves

reply.analysis: The privacy policy document clearly outlines the types of data collected by the app under different usage scenarios, ensuring transparency for users.

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the purpose of data collection and use as it states the scope of data processing, processing purposes, and legal bases, including informative use of the app, access to functions or data, hosting, user account, and processing of health data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly outlines the purposes of data collection and use, stating the legal bases for processing personal data and specifying different activities within the app for which data is collected and processed.
reply.reference: The app declares the purpose of data collection and use by detailing the scope of data processing, processing purposes, and legal bases. It includes sections on informative use of the app, access to functions or data, hosting, user account, and processing of health data. URL: https://www.onvy.health/privacy-app

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection and request data deletion by contacting the provider.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy states that users can revoke their consent for data processing at any time by contacting the provider. It further mentions that data will be deleted when its purpose no longer applies and there is no legal obligation to retain it.
reply.reference: Data subjects may revoke their consent at any time by contacting us, for example, using the contact details provided in our privacy policy. The data will be deleted when the purpose for which it was collected no longer applies and there is no obligation to retain it. Further information is available in the provider's privacy policy at https://www.onvy.health/privacy-app.

reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: The app shares data with Apple Inc., Google Ireland Limited, AppsFlyer Ltd., Amazon Web Services EMEA Sarl, Terra Enabling Developers, Inc., and PostHog.
